1133213213133221.content:
Carl put his ear to the door to listen more closely. They were footsteps, and they were getting closer. They were also fast, like there were multiple people approaching. And every time he thought they must be right outside the door by now the steps kept getting louder too. Suddenly things clicked for him as the steady patter came to a halt and a familiar voice whispered to him.

"Carl? Are you in there?"

"Mira?! Oh my god, I'm so happy to hear you." He hissed back, trying to keep his voice down for the sleeping bear.

"I'm so sorry I left you there. I completely forgot."

"It's okay. Just please get me out of here. The door is locked and I can't open it. And if she wakes up I'm history." He tried to keep his composure, but the despair in his voice was clear as day. Mira thought fast before giving Carl a very simple instruction.

"Get away from the door. I'll bash it in. Once it's broken, run to me as fast as you can."

He didn't need to be told twice. The man leapt out of the way and covered his head to protect against any flying debris. Outside the house Mira reared back on her four back legs and prepared to free her date. She swung forwards, four large spindly limbs coming together to deliver a mighty blow to the door. With a deafening crash they forced the door open, shattering the wooden beam. Miraculously the door itself seemed mostly unscathed. The noise shook Carl, but he knew he had to run now or Matroska would catch him, the bear shuddering away with a snort. As fast as he could he bolted out the front door towards the giant spider. Even now there was a pang of hesitation felt running towards the giant monster. But after the journey into Matroska he knew there were bigger monsters around and Mira wasn't one of them.

The giant spider was taken aback a little. She expected the little man running towards her, but she didn't expect him to be completely naked. He also smelled kinda weird. But there was not time to get into that as a loud roar boomed from the house.

"What the FUCK?!" Matroska yelled as she stormed out the door. But all she saw was Mira's huge abdomen racing away, a stream of "Sorry." echoing into the woods.

Carl had been grabbed and placed on the giant spider's back, hanging on to some of the spiny protrusions as she went full speed away from the bear's abode. Once they were sure it was safe and there were no angry bear women following her Mira slowed down to a crawl. Finally there was time for some emotions and Carl was the first to act, leaning down and giving the huge abdomen an awkward hug.

"Thank you so much for coming back. I was this close to becoming bear food." He muttered.

"You do smell like you've been through something. I went back to the bar and they told me you'd left with Matroska. So there was no time to waste. I don't know how she does it, but that bear has a bigger appetite for humans than anyone else in these parts. Even I don't eat that many." Mira replied calmly, sending a shiver down Carl's spine. It was a none too subtle reminder that his date wasn't shy about eating people either. He wondered if tonight was going to just end in her belly instead.

"I guess that also explains why you're naked. Hope it wasn't too drafty just now." Mira continued.

"I mean, if I wanted to be warm and toasty I would've stay in that bear's belly. But you're a spider, can't you use your silk to make me some clothes?" He asked, a little nervous.

"I'm a spider, Carl, not a tailor." She replied, a little annoyed. He gave a short laugh. "I know, I'm only joking. I think there's a set of spare clothes in my car, but I haven't got the foggiest clue where that would be from here."

Mira thought about the situation for a moment, then an idea sprang to mind. "Oh, if I take you to where we met, could you find the way from there?"

Carl barely had to say yes before the giant spider was off again. It was remarkable how quickly she could move among the trees, skittering up, over, around and through them to maintain a tremendous speed. It didn't take very long for them to arrive back at the webbed up site of their first encounter. Mira gave a weird, nervous noise at the sight of all the trees covered in silk. Hopefully the man wouldn't realize that this was the work of a very anxious spider eager for a date. She set him down to let him find his bearings. He took the opportunity to also quickly retrieve his camera.

"Alright, I think it's that way. Near the road."

"Aaaah, that one." Mira nodded, hoisting him back up and completing the final leg of the journey in record time. The winding forest path he had to follow turned out to be no more than a minute away from his car at giant spider speed. He got down on all fours and reached underneath it to find the spare set of keys he'd hidden away for emergencies like this one. He popped open the trunk and dug around, pulling out some ratty looking clothes. He was more than happy to put them on, finally cutting off the chilling breeze.

"So I guess this is goodbye?" Mira said, giving a creepy spider version of a smile.

"Yeah, I guess so. Though if you're up for it, maybe we can go for another date?" Carl stammered back.

"Wait, really? After everything that happened tonight."

"Let's be honest here, I was in way over my head when we met. But you saved my life, I think that warrants at least one real date." He tried to sound confident, but Carl let out an involuntary yelp when Mira's long legs swept him towards her head for a weird hug. She planted her best impression of a kiss on his chest before he returned the favor and kissed her on where he thought her cheek was.

Carl got into his car and drove away, watching Mira's towering figure slowly slink into the horizon as she lifted one thin limb up high and waved at him. Today had been a rollercoaster and though there was still something deeply unnerving about her, a part of him couldn't wait for their next date.

Only after what felt like an eternity of the two bears having him at their mercy did Stephan finally get another glimpse of light. He fell to his knees, rubbed and squeezed sore by the two polar bear women. His smile couldn't be wider.

"Hah, look at the state of him. I hope we didn't wear him out too much. We've not even gotten to the fun part yet." Inge lamented, but Hel knew better.

"Don't you worry, he'll be just fine when the time comes." She grabbed him and slipped the man underneath her, burying him up to his neck under herself again. His head was allowed freedom as the two bears watched some tv, taking turns to sit on the man. He just complimented their lovely behinds, chatting casually with them as though the weight on his back wasn't even there.
1151311321331132223133.title: The only thing better than one oversized bear butt

choices: They take turns wrestling Stephan
Inge has an odd request for Stephan
The bear women let Stephan make the first move
11513113213311322231332.content:
Time flew as Stephan was steadily squashed into the couch whilst calmly chatting with the two bears. He came to learn a bit more about their jobs too. Turns out that in spite of her less well-trained look Inge is every bit as fierce of a warrior when she needs to be. The stories of fighters underestimating her only to be taught a painful lesson were numerous. Apparently it wasn't common practice, but she made a meal out of many of them. "How else do you think all this happened?" She joked, patting her belly. She even talked about crushing them into submission with her ass. Stephan could hardly believe it, lying underneath that magnificent heavy butt. Who would protest something as nice as that? Inge blushed brightly at his compliments.

Hel looked over at the clock and back to Inge and Stephan. "You know, I think it's high time we take this little adventure to the bedroom."

Inge nods and stands up, peeling the man off the couch and cradling him in her arms. Hel didn't mind, simply chuckling at the cute gesture. The three of them entered the bedroom and Inge immediately threw herself onto the bed. Stephan found himself encased between her pillowy chest and the soft mattress. He murmured with delight, but any noise he made was muffled beneath the rustling of two large bear bodies onto the bed.

Stephan let out a small gasp as those huge, smothering tits finally left him. His training with Hel included holding his breath and it didn't take a psychic to see he would need it tonight. Laid out in front of him was Inge. Every curvaceous inch of her body was covered in soft fur. It was hard for him not to immediately leap into her embrace. But there was another contender for his eager attention. He looked behind him to see Hel almost mirroring the other bear's position. Her more athletic figure looked enticing, but before he could make a move she asked him with a voice sweet as honey.

"Where do you want to start? Me or her?"

Though he didn't want to sound cocky, Stephan could only think of one appropriate answer. "Come now, don't be shy. Let's have both of you at the same time."

Hel and Inge exchanged a glance. They knew how to overwhelm this bold request in just the right way. With a quick shuffle they closed in on him, their thick arms guiding the man a few steps north until he was stood between their heads. Stephan giggled as they closed in and gave him some gentle kisses. This soon grew into longer and deeper kisses, the man frequently turning to ensure both bears would get an even share of his attention. But when Inge reared back a little for her next smooch he could tell something was up. She closed in again and suddenly opened her big maw wide. At the same time the hairs on his neck stood straight up as Hel's hot breath washed over them.

There was no time for him to react as Stephan found himself in the middle of one huge kiss. He shuddered as he felt a stray tooth rub along his neck as the two bear women locked lips with eachother, catching the man in the middle. Both Hel and Inge assailed him with their tongues. They lapped and slobbered like he was a living lollipop, eager drench him in saliva and take in all the subtle notes of his flavour. Inge didn't usually eat people outside of work, but this one made it really damn tempting. The intimate kiss seemed to go on for an eternity, Stephan again thanking his lucky stars for his increased stamina. Finally they parted with a soggy, wet smack.

"You suuuuure you wanna handle two of us at once?" Hel cooed teasingly.

He rubbed the worst of the saliva from his face and gave her a smile. "I didn't train for nothing." He added, the bears loving his bravado. They shuffled closer to eachother, shrinking the gap until it was nearly impossible for Stephan to move. Their bellies were a strange mix of sensations. Inge's soft pudgy mass was a stark contrast to Hel's hardened abs. They tried to undermine his footing to smother them man completely between their bodies, but Stephan proved to be a worthy contender in their little game. Soon the three of them were panting with excitement, taking a quick minute to recharge.

"I didn't think you'd be able to keep up. Impressive, for a human." Inge commented with a naughty grin.

"Heh, couldn't have done it without Hel." He replied, rubbing her shoulder.

"Well, I hope she's trained you well for the next part, because I think it's about time you get to work." Inge teased.
11513113213311322231332.title: Inge and Hel take Stephan to the bedroom

choices: Hel lets go, Stephan is swallowed whole
Hel pulls Stephan out
Hel has another idea for this situation
115131132133113222313322.content:
The polar bear woman sat herself down in front of Stephan, her belly jiggling a little as she did. She leaned in close and whispered in his ear.

"How do you feel about deep-throating?" Her voice was dripping with lust. He was almost surprised she was still asking him instead of just doing it.

"You mean like sticking your tongue down my throat?" He gulped a little, trying to imagine that thick slobbery muscle going down his gullet. She could probably almost reach his stomach.

"No." She giggled. "I mean sticking you down my throat."

Stephan's eyes shot wide open. Did she just ask if she could eat him? Inge was quick to catch on to his fear and gasped a little, realizing what he must be imagining. "Oh no, not like that. I mean Hel holding your legs and you going down my gullet. Don't worry, you won't see the inside of this belly unless you want to."

The man wasn't sure which part was weirder. Her idea of deep-throating or the open invitation to go into her stomach. But he had to admit, the former did sound like a bit of kinky fun. He looked over to Hel, who seemed to be on board as well. With a quick nod of approval the bears sprung into action. His world turned upside down as his girlfriend grabbed him by his ankles and dangled him between the two. They exchanged a sly glance. From his new viewpoint the man got a generous look at Inge's breasts. They looked impossibly soft and plush. They also looked to be getting closer fast.

With a soft bwoompf Inge and Hel buried the man's torso between their chests. He squirmed and wriggled in such delightful ways. Inge couldn't wait to feel those squirms inside of her. After a little more mammary massaging they parted the gates of that fluffy heaven and held him a little higher.

"So, whose got the best tits?" Hel said teasingly. Even with his brain overwhelmed with desire Stephan knew he should probably pick his words carefully. He gave her a wicked grin.

"Not answering that. Because frankly making me choose between you two is just plain evil." He stated flatly. Both bear women giggled at his response. It was hard to argue with his position. Inge laid herself down in Hel's lap, shuffling onto her back and opening her maw wide. Only now did it really sink in with Stephan what he'd signed up for. The pink cavern was lined with rows of fearsome teeth, off-white spikes that could rend a man apart in seconds. And at the back was a gullet eager to swallow him whole. He was given a second to ponder which fate would be worse, chewed up of swallowed alive and enduring the stomach. He let out a small yelp as Hel suddenly accelerated his descent.

His head dropped into her maw and stale breath was the first to enter his senses. Next was the sounds of her heavy breathing. Already the whisper of a moan could be heard in there. Lastly he forced his eyes open and watched the undulating flesh ahead. Why the hell did he say yes to this?

A small splat echoed in the damp cavern as his face made contact with the ravenous hole. It opened wide and Inge leaned forward a little bit to take in Stephan's entire head. Hel carefully lowered him as her friend gulped loudly, sending more and more of him down her throat. She could feel her neck bulge a little as the scrawny man filled it. Her practiced breathing remained steady as she enjoyed every second of this amazing sensation.

Stephan felt the greedy insides of Inge's esophagus take hold of him. Every muscle in the long tube tried to force him in deeper. Were it not for Hel's strength he'd be rocketing down into that stomach by now. Hopefully this wasn't some sort of trick. Though knowing his girlfriend, this wouldn't be the kind of prank she'd pull. In a way, the squeezing walls felt kind of nice. Like a really weird, wet full-body hug. And he wasn't alone in enjoying it. Between the slightly strained breaths he could hear Inge moaning. Or well, it sounded like one would expect a moan to sound with a full throat. And he couldn't deny that it felt great for him too. The warm, saliva-slickened walls had his manhood rising up fast.

Hel's grip was tight on his legs and soon her arms bumped into the edge of Inge's snout. This was as deep as her cute little boyfriend would go. At least for now. Her friend shot her a tempting look, almost daring her to let go of the man. But Stephan trusted her to be his way out of that ravenous gullet.
115131132133113222313322.title: Inge has an odd request for Stephan

choices: Sam Clemmings - 18 Years old. Quarterback and D&D Nerd
John Smith. 29 Years old. CIA agent.
Robert Butcher. 32 years old. Barber
Charles DeMagio. 63 years old. Trying the Dating Game Again
Other Choices
1152.content:
Sam Clemmings - 18 Years old. Quarterback of the local High School football team, and an avid bow hunter, Sam is the sort who looks like he'd give D&D players a wedgie, and a swirly, and a wedgie-swirly, if not for the fact that he is a D&D nerd. He likes taking the position of the Tank, although he's good at ranged roles, or even sneaky ones. Still under his parents' roof, Sam doesn't have the app, but his older brother has warned him that dates through it can be rather, strange. However, his one geekier-looking friend is about to take him to a D&D session that's about to get strange, even by D&D standards.

John Smith. 29 Years old. CIA agent. Due to his relative young age, and single status, his superiors asked him to set up an account to quietly determine the threat that the Monster World posses for the United States of America.

Robert Butcher. 32 years old. Barber by trade, Robert has never had the time to actually date. Maybe now he can find someone.

Charles DeMagio. 63 years old. Ten years ago, his wife of thirty wonderful years died. Now, he's decided to re-enter the dating game. After finding out about the App from his grandson, he's decided to try his luck. Hopefully his date won't give him a heart attack.
1152.title: More eligible bachelors

choices: Strong, Heavy Armor-wearing Fighter, that specialized in the Archery style.
Strength-based Ranger with the Archery Fighting Style.
A Strength-based Rogue with a special bow.
A Paladin with a Holy Bow.
A Barbarian with a strength-based bow.
11521.content:
Sam rode home with his buddy, Carl. Football practice had been good, no injuries.

"That was a good throw," Carl said. "Fifty-two yards. Bit of a record, right?"

Sam chuckled. "Defense is good this year. Hard to get to anyone close without them getting tackled. Sneaky guy slipping pass them though, another story."

Carl chuckled as well. "Got to cover everyone. Got plans for later?"

"Plan to work on my bow a bit," said Sam. "Going to go hunting this weekend."

"You up for a game of D&D?" Carl asked.

Sam looked at his buddy. Physically, the two looked nothing alike - Sam looked like a Jock, and Carl looked like a Nerd. But, D&D had fostered a friendship that would be hard to break.

"Where and when?" he asked.

Carl chuckled. "If you're interested, I'll pick you up Saturday, at 8 in the morning, and take you there. Bring you back Sunday, at 5 in the afternoon."

"Sounds like a Marathon game," said Sam. "Any girls playing?"

Carl grinned. "A few of them. Although I will say this, this group's version of D&D would make Matt Mercer and those other D&D guys jealous, especially the special effects."

"Alright," said Sam. "Count me in."



The next day, Sam was waiting, with an overnight bag. He watched as Carl pulled into the driveway.

"Got your stuff?" Carl asked.

"Change of clothes, and my books," said Sam. "We are playing 5th Edition, right?"

"More or less," said Carl. "Although you probably won't be able to use any magic-users."

"A No-Magic campaign?" Sam asked, throwing his bag into the car.

Carl grinned. "Quite the opposite. In this guy's campaign, your character's based off of you."

"Let me guess, you got the wizard role?" Sam asked, sitting down.

Carl chuckled. "Dexterity-based rogue. Thief to be exact."

"You're not very thievish," Sam said.

"No, but I've had to dodge more than a few bullies, before I ran into you," said Carl.

"Well, I don't like bullies all that much," said Sam. "Is Paladin available?"

"Your character will be based off of you," said Carl. "Still, I've enjoyed playing with this group."



About half an hour later, they pulled up to a home that Sam didn't recognize, in an area he didn't know. "Where are we?"

"Monster World," said Carl. "These guys have some fun ideas of playing games like D&D."

"You mean we're playing with actual-"

"Yep."

"And the girls are?"

"They are."

Sam looked at the car, and wondered if he could drive back. Then he sighed as he recalled the reason Carl always drove - Carl was the one who had a license.

Carl slapped his back.

"Come on," he said. "This is a good group. They don't pull shit like Tommy's group did."

"Don't remind me," said Sam. "I'd rather never touching the dice than to play with them again."

"Your guy wasn't the one they robbed and threw into a hole, just because of their race," said Carl.

"True, but my guy objected to it, and was killed for it," said Sam. "The Assassin stabbed me in my sleep."

"Well, this group's different," said Carl. "We all help each other out."

"Alright," Sam said. "Guess one game won't hurt. But, if I don't like it, I'd like to leave."

"I'll let Zorzar know," said Carl. "He's a good DM."

Sam followed his friend, as Carl went into the house. First thing he saw was a human-sized dragon, with a sheet of cookies.

"Hey Mrs. Slirzim," said Carl.

"Nice to see you," the dragoness said. "Is this a friend of yours?"

"He is," said Carl. "Everyone else here?"

"Down in the basement," said Mrs. Slirzim. "Mind taking these cookies down? The steaks will be along in about half an hour."

"Sure thing," Carl said, as he took the sheet. "Sugar cookies?"

"Bought the mix from that Walmart place," said Mrs. Slirzim. "Hopefully it should be fine."

Carl picked one up, and bit into it. "Slightly burnt, but it's not bad."

"And you want your steak cooked, right?" the dragoness asked.

"Yes, and my friend would like his cooked as well," said Carl.

"I'll get on it." The dragoness went back into the kitchen.

"Cooked steak?" Sam asked. "Why did you have to tell her that?"

"Some of these people like their steak to be extra - rare," said Carl.

"Still, steak for a game?" Sam asked.

"It's cut into pieces you can pick up with your fingers, and just put into your mouth," said Carl. "No fork or knife needed, and you can still roll."

"Still, steak?" said Sam.

"These sessions will cause you to burn more than a few calories," said Carl. "You'll need every bite." He walked up to a door, and opened it. "Come on! You're going to have fun!"



Within a few seconds, Carl and Sam were down in the basement, and Sam saw the other players. Sitting at the head of a table was another human-sized dragon.

"Hey Zorzar," said Carl.

"Hey Carl," said the dragon. "How's my mom's cookies?"

"Better than her last batch at any rate," said Carl. "Little less flame, and it might be right."

"Need any milk to wash them down?" a minotaur, with a female voice, asked.

"I brought water for that," said Carl. "Thanks for the offer though."

Sam looked at Carl.

Carl chuckled. "The last batch of cookies was charcoal. Needed something to wash them down with. By the way, this is Butterfly. Butterfly, this is Sam."

The minotaur chuckled. "Nice to meet you."

Sam looked, and saw a lion-like guy, a goat-like woman, some crow-like person. There was a cat-like woman, some sort of fish-dude, an orc-looking fella, some sort of elf-like person, an elephant person. There was a lizard-person, and human-like person with green skin and long pointy ears, with multiple earring piercings.

Carl pointed them out. "Huntor, Clip-Clop, Clicky, Pouncer, Shuom, Ripsnout, Clover, Kel, Usk, and Kalo. Of course, easier to think of them in D&D and other such terms where their respective races are concerned - Leonin, Satyr, Kenku, although he can actually talk and not mimic voices, Tabaxi, Triton, Orc, Drow, Loxodon, Lizardfolk, and Verdan."

"Verdan?" Sam asked.

"More fitting than one of the Gith subraces," said Carl.

Kalo chuckled. "I like the idea of using earrings to pin my ears together to keep them from flapping in the wind."

"Okay," Sam said. He then sat down at one of the open chairs. "So, any special rules for stat creation?"

Zorzar chuckled, and looked at Carl. "What have you told him?"

"Told him that the character's based off of himself," said Carl. "That, and you use very good Special Effects."

"That's one way of putting it," said Pouncer. "Better than the miniatures you guys seem to use."

"Let's start the session," said Huntor. "He can find out first-hand."

"Alright," said Zorzar. He got out what looked to be character sheets. "Take yours and pass them around."

Sam watched as the table turned into a forested landscape, and as each person accepted their sheet, a character that resembled them appeared on the table. He also noticed that each person that had accepted their sheets seemed to go into a trance. Eventually, Carl turned to pass him a blank sheet, and Sam looked at his friend - it was if the lights were on, but no one was home.

Sam looked at the table. The party looked like they were waiting for someone. He looked at Zorzar.

"Are you playing?" the dragon asked. "It's perfectly safe."

Sam gulped nervously, and carefully took the sheet from Carl, ready to drop it if need be. To his amazement, the paper lit up, and filled itself out, and he found himself in a forest, wearing armor, carrying weapons and supplies. He looked over, and saw Carl, who looked a lot like the typical rogue.

"First time was a shock for me too," he said. He walked over to his friend, flipped his right hand, palm up, and whistled. "Nice stats by the way."

Sam looked at his wrist, and saw his character stats - high constitution, strength, good dexterity, and mental stats, as well as his various abilities. More importantly, he found out that he was a -
11521.title: Sam Clemmings - 18 Years old. Football and D&D Guy

choices: Pouncer's number was ten higher. 20+
His number was ten higher. 20+
Pouncer just edged him out with the modifiers.
He just edged Pouncer out with the modifiers.
They'd tied for Initiative.
115211.content:
Sam looked at himself. He was wearing Full Plate Armor, which ruled out Ranger and Rogue, as well as Barbarian, and he had a longbow, a longsword, and a shield, which was plain with no obvious Holy symbols, ruling out a Paladin.

"A longbow, in addition to a longsword and shield?" he asked. "Thought that a strength-based fighter used javelins."

Carl chuckled. "Normally, but as you can see, your Dexterity is fairly good. Also, you got the Archery Fighting Style. Makes up for the dexterity compared to your strength difference. Also, guess the sheet took into account that you had done some Martial Arts stuff. You've got Tavern Brawler. A d4 for those punches and kicks as opposed to the normal 1 + strength Mod. You also got Athletics and Acrobatics for being an Athlete, Nature as your Human skill, as well as Intimidation and Survival. Not too shabby."

"Me, intimidating?" Sam asked.

"You can be scary when you're protecting those you care about," said Carl.

Sam grinned at the memory of when he first encountered Carl, and drove off the bullies that had been bothering him. "I remember that."

"Sadly, you lack the Charisma to be a Paladin, but at least you have no negative modifiers," said Carl.

"Well, that's good," said Sam. "So, how does all of this work? I mean, how do I Roll for Initiative and other such things?"

"You want a quick Demo?" Carl asked.

"Might as well," said Sam.

Carl grinned. "Think that you can take on a Barbarian?"

Sam looked over at the orc, Ripsnout. "Would that be him?"

Carl chuckled. "He's the Wizard." Carl pointed at the cat-lady. "Pouncer's the Barbarian." He waved her over.

"What's the issue?" she asked.

Sam noticed that she wore very little in the way of clothing, and figured that both her Constitution and Dexterity must be very high, in order for her to be confident enough to not bother wearing any armor.

"Friend needs a sparring session to warm up," said Carl. "Want to help?"

Pouncer grinned, her teeth being revealed. "Sure." She looked at Sam. "So, other than not killing your guy, any restrictions? No Magic Weapons? No Magic? No Innate Racial Abilities?"

"I doubt an actual foe would be fair to me, so let's just say, No-Holds-Barred," said Sam. "Hit me with everything you've got."

Pouncer looked at Carl. "This might be fun."

"Well, let's make it somewhat fair and have him roll for his four items first," said Carl.

"Items?" Sam asked.

"Zorzar gives us a magic item every two levels, and one for starting out," said Carl. "Since we, and you, are level 6, that's four items."

"How does that work?" Sam asked.

"Well, there's no limit to Attuned Items for one," said Carl. "As for the other, imagine that you have a regular d10 as well as the d10 percentile in your left hand, shake it a little bit, and toss."

Sam imagined he had the dice, shook his hand - to his surprise, he heard then clanking together - and tossed them, getting a 29 to appear in front of him. That was when his bracers changed, and he saw arrows appear as part of the design.

"Bracers of Archery," said Carl. "Nice."

Sam had to grin. "Better archer I guess." He rolled the dice again, and his armor became decorated with fish and shells. "Mainer's armor?"

"Got a third swimmer," said Usk, as the lizard person came over. "What's the next item?"

Sam rolled again, and his armor had a strange sheen to it.

"Is he fudging his rolls?" Usk asked. "Mariner's armor and Adamantine Armor?"

Pouncer grinned. "This is going to be good."

The others came over.

"Last roll buddy," said Carl. "Let's see what you've got."

Sam rolled again, and an amulet appeared on a necklace around his neck.

"And a Periapt of Wound Closure," said Pouncer. "No worries about Death Saves with you."

"So, good with Archery, good swimming speed, Critical Hits don't bother me, and I'm good on the Death Saves," said Sam. "Cool."

Pouncer chuckled. "Still got a few tricks up my sleeve."

"That you do," said Carl. "Still, this will be a fun match." He looked at Sam. "Are you sure about the No Restrictions part?"

"I'm sure," said Sam.

"Okay," said Carl. "Try not to lose. Pouncer likes to torment her prey."

Pouncer chuckled. "This will be fun."

"Anyways," said Carl. "Same general idea for rolling the dice for the items applies to your attack rolls and such."

Carl and the rest stepped back.

Pouncer pulled a great-axe from a scabbard on her back. "You're going to have a hard time hitting my AC. Between having 20 Dexterity, and 20 Constitution, I got that Sweet 20 AC, and that's without a shield."

"I got 16 strength, and my proficiency bonus is +3," said Sam. "I figure, if I roll at least a 14, I should hit you. Also, Critical Hits, those will do extra damage to you."

"Well, I got 18 in my Strength, so that means I only need a 13 to hit you," said Pouncer. "As it is, you only have a 16 in your Con. I got twenty more hit points than you. Further more, you're a Champion Fighter. Extra chance for a Critical hit, plus some nice stat bumps. Thing is, I took Totem Warrior, starting with Bear, meaning less damage while raging."

Sam chuckled nervously at this. "Good choice."

"Then there's my racial abilities," said Pouncer.

"Cat claws, right?" Sam asked.

Pouncer grinned. "It's a bit more than just the ability to scratch you. Also, I also have plenty of magic items. Some of them require a saving throw."

"Sounds like fun," said Sam.

"Roll for initiative," said Carl.

Sam shook his left hand, and noticed Pouncer doing the same. They threw out their hands, and watched as a number appeared before them, and then their modifiers were added in. Sam looked at his number, and that of Pouncer, and saw that .....
115211.title: How do I Roll for Initiative?

choices: Nat20! Automatic Hit! Cat's Eye! Extra Damage!
Nat1! Automatic Miss! Sam's in Trouble Now!
14, which becomes a 20. It hits.
13, becomes a 19, barely missing.
19, which becomes a 25, but still not as much damage.
1152111.content:
Sam had to blink. With Modifiers, Pouncer's roll was 25, compared to his modified 15.

Pouncer looked at him. "Are you sure you don't want me to use any restrictions?" she asked.

"Give me your best shot," Sam said, as he got his shield ready. "Magic weapons, Class Tricks, Racial Abilities. I'm ready for it."

Pouncer looked over at Carl. "Worth a shot." She looked back at Sam. "Cat's Prey!"

It was in that moment, Sam knew that he'd made a Big Mistake. As he looked at Pouncer, he felt like he was afraid of her, as if he was a mouse being hunted by a housecat. He also realized that attacking her would be useless while he was afraid of her. "I'm going to Hold my Action," he said, drawing his sword. "I'll Attack if you get close to me."

"That's just fine," Pouncer said, with a smile. She tapped her great-axe. "Ensnare Prey!"

Vines shot out from the great-axe, and bound Sam's arms to his body, preventing him from moving. As he struggled to get free, he heard a voice.

"As you struggle to break free, you have some trouble with your footing." The voice was that of Zorzar. "Make a Dexterity Saving Throw with Disadvantage, due to being Restrained."

Sam shook his left hand, and released it. He watched as a 15, and then a 9 appeared before him.

"Sorry Sam," said Zorzar. "One off."

Sam fell Prone, on the ground. He resumed struggling as Pouncer walked up to him.

"All nice and bound," she said. She grabbed a vine, and lifted him back to his feet. "I like looking into my Prey's eyes though. Cute face. I won't scratch it if you let me kiss you."

Sam gulped. "Alright."

Pouncer chuckled, and kissed him on the lips. "There. Not so bad now, was it."

Sam nodded - situation not withstanding, the kiss was a nice one.

That was when Pouncer grinned. "Of course, the fun's not done, little one."

Sam's eyes bulged, as he soon found himself the size of a mouse. Worse than that, his sword and shield hadn't shrunk with him!

Pouncer looked down at him and chuckled, as she pulled off what looked like a sliver of flesh from her lips. "Only 18 AC. Much easier to hit. Enhanced Potion of Diminution."

Sam pulled out his bow, and started running. On the plus side, he still had 30 feet of movement. On the bad side, his attacks would, more than likely, do even less damage than that of a regular Reduce spell.

"It's a d6 for the Damage Reduction," Pouncer said. "On the plus side, being shrunk to mouse-size gives you Advantage on a Stealth Check. Should help you out a bit by canceling the Disadvantage from the Heavy Armor! You still have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls due to being frightened of me though."

Sam got under the base of a bush, where he could enjoy a bit of cover. "In that case, I call a Shot on your Eye!"

Pouncer grinned. "Let's see if the Dice Gods are with you."

Sam shook his hand. With Modifiers, and his Fighting Style, and his Proficiency Bonus, he needed at least a 14 on the dice roll to hit her 20AC. But, with Disadvantage, the odds of getting both over that were against him. He threw the dice. One was a 20, which would have been an Auto-hit if not for the Disadvantage. He then watched the other number appear. It was a ....
1152111.title: When Cats Play with their Prey

choices: Sam decides to use Pouncer's Words Against her, and scores a Blow with his armor
Pouncer decides to savor her Prey, and Swallows Sam
Sam manages to slip free of Pouncer's grasp.
Pouncer decides to get intimate with her Prey, and introduces Sam to her Pussy
Sam decides that it would be best to Forfeit the fight.
11521112.content:
It was a Nat 1 - an Auto-Miss, regardless of any bonuses or modifiers.

"Oh crap," Sam muttered, as he used his bow, only to miss the large, to him, cat-lady. He rolled for his second attack. That one also failed, as he loosed his arrow. "Action Surge! Two Attacks!" Again, he rolled his dice. Both attempts Failed to even touch the big cat, the puny arrows missing her, one barely.

"And that's your turn come to an end," said Pouncer. She walked up to the bush, and managed to grab him. She looked him over. "You know, you're covered in Adamantine. If I threw you at another target, would I be able to do Critical Damage if I managed to hit them?" She looked at the others. "What do you think? Would he count as an Adamantine Weapon?"

"Probably!" Carl called out.

Sam looked over at Carl. "Can you help me buddy?"

"Only if you forfeit the fight," said Carl. "Not my fault that you didn't place any restrictions."

"At the moment, that means you're still my Prey," said Pouncer. "And you should know that when a cat catches a mouse, the mouse loses." She then gave him a rather wicked looking smile.

Sam gulped at the implications of her words. He then resumed trying to struggle from her hand.

"I like my Prey to struggle," said Pouncer. "It entertains my inner Predator."
11521112.title: Nat1! Automatic Miss! Sam's in Trouble Now!

choices: In 5 in-game minutes.
After a Short Rest
After a Long Rest
24 in-game hours
10 in-game hours
115211121.content:
Sam tried to struggle against Pouncer's grip, but it was of little use. It was when he looked at his gauntlets that he realized, and remembered something. He had Tavern Brawler, meaning he could do d4 damage with a punch, and since he was wearing Adamantine armor, including his gauntlets.....

He looked at Pouncer with a grin. "Thanks for the idea!" He rolled his d20s, and threw them. The number was high enough on the lowest d20, with mods. He joined his fists together, and slammed down on Pouncer's finger.

The reaction was immediate - Pouncer screamed in pain, and flung Sam away.

"Don't know what Saving throw this is, but I hope it's good enough!" Sam threw his dice again. Whatever the number was, Sam was able to grab onto Carl's Studded Leather Armor.

Pouncer came over, and she didn't look too happy as she held her finger with her other hand.

"I call a Truce!" Sam called out. "You might be able to grab and swallow me, but know that I'll still punch your stomach bad enough to make you regret eating me."

"He's got a point," said Ripsnout. "Even with a d6 reduction to his damage rolls, thanks to his Adamanitne armor, he's rolling 2d4s and has a +3 to his strength mod. Sooner or later, you'd let him out in order to not suffer from his punches. After all, a bee sting in the right place will fall anyone. Otherwise, he'd swim through your intestines, probably punching them whenever he could."

"He'd still take acid damage," said Huntor. "Still, the ability to swim and shrug off critical hits isn't to be sneezed at."

"I could modify the armor for that," said Kalo. "6th Level Artificers can do that."

"Well, who is what class anyways?" Sam asked.

"Well, Pouncer is the Barbarian, Kalo's the Artificer, Ripsnout's the wizard and I'm the rogue, as you know," said Carl. "Huntor, monk. Clip-Clop, cleric. Butterfly, druid. Clicky, paladin. Shuom, ranger. Clover, bard. Kel, sorcerer. Usk, warlock."

Sam watched as the others were indicated. "Okay," he said. "So, how long am I stuck like this?"

Pouncer walked up to Clip-Clop, who healed her finger. "Given the dosage you got, I'd say you should be back to normal....
115211121.title: Sam decides to use Pouncer's Words Against Her

choices: Save a Kidnapped Princess.
Kill an Evil Dragon
Explore a Dungeon for Treasure
Convince a Hostile Group to not invade the Kingdom
Capture a Bounty Target
1152111212.content:
"Well, you should be back to normal after a few hours, or a Short Rest," said Pouncer. "Also, to show that I have no hard feelings, Not Prey."

At this, Sam felt the majority of his fear of Pouncer just leave his body. All that was left was that fear one had when faced with a, presumably, dangerous predator. "So, I'm stuck like this for four hours?"

"Enhance Diminution potion," said Pouncer. "Four hours is what you'd be shrunk for for a mere touch of it on your bare skin. As you might have noticed, I used some lovely false lips when I kissed you."

"Reminds me of a scene in that Batman and Robin film where Robin used fake lips to avoid being poisoned by Poison Ivy," said Sam.

Pouncer chuckled. "Whom do you think I got the idea from? Kissing someone to shrink them, and then turning them into Prey. You'd be surprised at how quick information comes out of someone's mouth in order to avoid being eaten."

"Well, I'm kind of useless at the moment," Sam said. "I mean, you guys are so much bigger than me, and I don't have a sword or another melee weapon."

"I can make it up to you by letting you ride on my shoulder," said Pouncer. "That and I do have a blade in your size." She removed what looked to be a needle from her pouch, and carefully passed it to Sam.

Sam looked it over. The needle was actually a rapier, that was black in color. "What is it?"

"Sprites and Pixies call it Tiny Death," said Carl. "Adds 2d10 Necrotic Damage when you first attack someone with it, and regular 1d8 piercing damage afterwards. We took it off of a particularly Evil Sprite that had a nice sized bounty on his head."

"Can't sneeze at a thousand gold," said Butterfly. "We were allowed to keep the sword as loot. Not really useful in a fight for someone of humanish size, but when you want to interrogate someone by threatening to ruin their eye forever, it has its uses."

"What happened to the sprite that used to own the sword?" Sam asked, as he placed the sword around his waist.

"Suffice to say, they were sentenced to Death for their crimes," said Carl. "Pouncer volunteered to be the Executioner."

Pouncer grinned. "That was fun. Tore his wings off first. After that, tied him up with strips of leather, covered him in bacon grease, and he slid down my throat real easy. Took him half an hour in-game to finally pass out and drown in my stomach acids. After than, he was just another piece of meat." She held out her hand.

"That brings up a good question, what happens if we die like this?" Sam asked, as he stepped onto Pouncer's hand

Carl chuckled. "Roll up another sheet then. Maybe you'll get a slightly different character - different class, different background - but still based off of yourself."

"You got to have something of the basics needed for the class in order to become that class though," said Ripsnout. "I've actually been learning about magic, so ending up as a wizard, that was possible."

"Well, I play a lot of football," said Sam, as he got onto Pouncer's shoulder. "I also do a lot of bow hunting."

"Explains a few things," said Pouncer, as she and the rest resumed walking, having picked up Sam's normal-size longsword and shield. "And the Tavern Brawler feat seems to indicate that either you get into fistfights, or you were into Martial Arts."

"Wrestling and some Karate," said Sam. "Kind of wanted to do Mixed Martial Arts, but my older brother was big into football, and well, I wanted to be like him. Funny how that ended up leading me into playing D&D with Carl."

"How did that happen?" Butterfly asked.

"Pack of bullies were picking on me, like usual," said Carl. "Knocking my books out my hands and that sort of stuff. Then comes this big muscular guy, who sees four others harassing me, and he grabs the biggest one, spins him around to face him, and says 'Four on one isn't very fair, unless you're taking on someone bigger.' Better than that, a couple of the other football players showed up. Those bullies did some calculating of the outcomes for that encounter, and decided to leave. I mean, the other football players might not have cared about me, but they'd at least back up their teammate. After that, Sam helped me pick up my books, noticed what the were, and asked if he could learn how to play, and if there was a club on school. We tend to have fun together."

"Except with Tommy's group," said Sam. "Worst batch of Psychopaths one could ever run into. Make the average Murderhobo seem friendly by comparison. I mean, we've dealt with Min-Maxers, Roleplayers, Powergamers, Rules-Lawyers, and others - I mean, all players have a touch of all of these sorts, but not only did these guys just kill everything, it was like they embodied all the worst aspects of all bad players. They also cheated, and Tommy let them get away with it. I mean - kill a shop owner, and there should be guards or someone after you, unless you're clever enough to hide the body somehow - but these guys never faced the consequences of their actions."

"Killed my guy for being of a 'different' race just to get his rare gear, and killed his for objecting to that," said Carl.

"Sounds like one of those Horror stories on that one site," said Huntor.

"I would have about given up playing had I not heard about your group," said Carl. "I know I've enjoyed my time in this group. I hope Sam does too."

"I can't say that I've had much fun though," Sam muttered. "Kind of stuck in a reduced state at the moment."

"Perhaps you should look at the advantages," said Pouncer.

"Good way to lose your virginity without actually losing it," said Butterfly. "Carl knows about that one."

Sam looked over at Carl, who was blushing.

"Don't tell my mom," he said.

"Okay," said Sam. He looked at Pouncer. "Um, any rules about those sorts of things?"

"Since we're a Good-Aligned party, getting Consent would be a very good idea," said Pouncer. "Good idea in general, even if we were Evil-Aligned, as there's some Rules that Zorzar has, with No Rape being one of them, followed by No Cheating. Of course, if one's just messing around with one another, such as a No Restrictions fight, Zorzar is willing to lift that rule."

Sam's eyes bulged at the implications of this. "Would you have?"

Pouncer grinned. "You're of the right size to fit inside of me. That being said, you would have been fine. Maybe you'd even like it."

Sam chuckled nervously. He wasn't sure what kind of pickup line that was, but it was an interesting one to him.



After a while, the group stopped for a rest, and sat down under some trees.

Sam looked around. The scene was rather nice. He would have liked it better if he was full-sized, but the view was nice enough, with them being near the bank of a steam.

"I never did ask," he said. "What is the Quest that the group is supposed to be on?"

"Oh, one of the Usual ones," said Pouncer.
1152111212.title: Time for some walking.

choices: Pouncer asks Sam if he wants to explore her insides.
Pouncer asks Sam if he wants to get intimate with her.
The potion wears off, restoring Sam to Normal Size
Someone approaches the group
Someone attacks the group.
11521112125.content:
"Just a Bounty Capture really, so that we can build up our levels and get an in-game reputation," said Pouncer. "That being said, Zorzar's building things up to the good old Save the World from Evil Forces plot, but he's been looking up various myths from the Human Realm to see if there's something that he could use from one of them."

"Some of our myths might not be very flattering to Monsters such as yourself," said Sam. "I mean, the story about Odysseus has him blinding a cyclopes with a burning log."

"Ah, but the cyclopes had him prisoner, and was eating his men," countered Pouncer. "Clearly a case of self-defense in that situation."

"You know that story?" Sam asked.

"Name any of your mythological creatures, and you'll find it, or the race inspired by it," said Pouncer. "Wait until you encounter a gorgon - they don't turn you into a statue right off the bat, unless they catch you doing something exceptionally foolish. Luckily, they can reverse it, but they aren't so forgiving to those who commit serious crimes."

"What sorts of crimes are we talking about?" Sam asked.

"The kind that would get one sentenced to death, like murder," said Pouncer. "Our Real Life laws are similar enough that the average human doesn't have much to fear from the average monster, unless there's an accident or misunderstanding."

"What about from your criminal elements?" Sam asked.

"Funny enough, my father's a police officer," said Pouncer. "Smart criminals might trick or con, or just give a human something like a thrashing, but nothing fatal. The more foolish ones, they tend to be folks not suitable for the streets to begin with."

"Well, that's a relief," said Sam. "I'd hate to end up getting gobbled up."

"Funny, we have a kink related to that sort of thing," said Pouncer. "My older sister say's it's deep throating, and the idea is to swallow your mate's entire body."

Sam gulped at this.

Pouncer chuckled. "Don't worry. It's safe. The one who gets swallowed gets out, one way, or another. My sister's done it plenty of times, both the swallowing, and being swallowed."

"Sounds kind of scary though," said Sam.

"Well, we got about an hour or so before the potion wears off," said Pouncer. "Would you like to try it?"

"What if the potion wears off?" Sam asked. "What if I grow to full-size while inside of you?"

Pouncer chuckled. "Not really an issue. I can swallow human-sized prey, and bring it back up, or let it pass out my anus."

"Have you done that before?" Sam asked.

"In-game, yes, when we caught this human bandit captain, about three sessions back," said Pouncer. "We weren't rolling high enough to get him to talk the conventional Nice Guy, Nasty Guy manner, so we decided to get creative, and I used Cat's Prey on him, which I'd just learned, and I decided to give him a tour of my intestinal system. He had enough HP to make the trip, and he was very eager to talk afterwards, on the threat of me doing it again."

"Was Carl playing then?" Sam asked.

Pouncer grinned. "Freaked him out when he saw me do it, along with the other part. Still, it's on my Character sheet." She held up her wrist.

"'Swallow - Can makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Pouncer, and it takes 2d6 acid damage at the start of each of Pouncer's turns. Pouncer can have only one Medium-sized target swallowed at a time, but can have two small targets or eight tiny targets inside of them, and remain mobile. If Pouncer losses consciousness, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by them and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.'" Sam looked at Pouncer. "Is that a common ability?"

Pouncer chuckled. "In general, yep. Scales up even, sort of like a Monk's Martial Arts ability or some damage-dealing Cantrip. Idea is that you're supposed to do it to someone really tough to wear them down. That being said, there's another lovely section that can be applied to it." She pointed to another paragraph.

"Stomach Protection - While in her stomach, Pouncer can protect up to 8 targets from acid damage. Requires Concentration."

"Useless when I'm Raging of course," said Pouncer. "Outside of that though, me and other Predator types can keep our would-be meals safe from harm. Useful for interrogations, or transporting through terrain that would give others issues, like crossing a raging river, when the Predator is someone like Usk."

"Okay," said Sam. "So, this is a fair ability?"

"It is, although Carl was surprised to learn about it, as I mentioned," said Pouncer. "Seems only certain creatures have the ability to swallow others in your version of D&D."

"Yes," said Sam.

"Well, we all have our own takes on things I guess," said Pouncer. "Still, you got lucky - combined Mariner's and Adamantine Full Plate Armor."

"Acquisitions Incorporated had the Mithral +1 Armor, which removed disadvantage from stealth checks, and added 1 to the AC," said Sam. "Not really used except as a special item in that book's quest, but could serve as justification to combining various special conditions that don't require Attunement."

"Actually, we don't have that rule, unless the object forms an actual attachment to you," said Pouncer. "Useful if you locate, or get, items that don't fit your guy."

"I see," said Sam. "So, what are we going to do?"

Pouncer looked at him, and chuckled. "Depends."
11521112125.title: History and Abilities

choices: Simone
Nataly
Claire
You
More women
12.content:
Simone Andrewson. A 31 year old office manager who's thoroughly explored the dating scene already. She's never been one for long relationships and she's been with just about every type of man imaginable. All of it just left her so very bored. The sex was nice, but she was rearing to try something new. When she came across this monster dating app her eyes widened. A whole new selection that might finally satisfy her exotic tastes and long list of fetishes. She couldn't wait to get started.

Nataly Miller. 18 years old and fresh out of high school. For the last two years she was close to a boy, but on the final dance of the year he broke up with her in front of everyone. Never has she felt this humiliated in her life. In the days that followed she could only think of revenge amidst the bouts of crying for her broken heart. When she found the Monstr app she couldn't believe it. Perhaps this was a way to solve two problems at once. She could find a new boyfriend and perhaps convince said boyfriend to... take care of her cruel ex.

Claire van Sheffield. A 28 year old gardener with a burning passion for all things horse. Since she was a child she loved horses and as soon as possible she got into riding them. Throughout the years this interest never faded and now Claire can frequently be found at the stables tending to her horse, Chocolate Cream. Though she's had lewd thoughts about it, she'd never dare to do anything of that nature to a horse. It was a line she would never be willing to cross. But when she came across the dating app a whole new world opened up for her. Centaurs, satyrs and all manner of horse creatures, no matter how funny looking they were, she swiped right on all of them.

You. It's you. Why should all those other girls have all the fun? You decide to try out Monstr yourself and get to know some of these monsters a little more intimately.
12.title: A female human

choices: Marcel, a shy gelatinous cube
Chester, a werebear
Someone else
121.content:
Simone was curious to see what manner of strange creatures would be interested in her. The sheer diversity on offer through the Monstr app was spectacular, but that only made her feel more insecure. Why would any of these guys go for a dull human like her? But as she started chatting with them it quickly became clear that in their eyes she was far more interesting than she gave yourself credit for. It didn't take long for her to get in touch with someone special and a date was planned. They would be at her door any minute now. Simone didn't feel like eating at some noisy restaurant so she'd cooked up a delicious meal for two. Hopefully they would like it. She checks herself out one last time in the mirror as the doorbell rings. With a mix of joy and curiosity she approaches the door. Were it not for the app she would never have believed someone like him even existed.

Who is he?
121.title: Simone

choices: He calmly eats his meal
He wolfs his meal down like a hungry animal
He is remarkably refined, making her feel boorish in comparison
1212.content:
"Good evening." A deep voice growled. She had exchanged pictures before but Simone still found herself flustered and surprised to see him in the flesh. Chester was a werebear, a freakish mix of human and ursine features. He stood just a little taller than the door frame, his broad chest and slightly pudgy belly covered in thick brown fur. His arms and legs still seemed mostly human, but his feet were thickly padded and clawed. Similarly his fingers were tipped with fearsome black claws. He didn't wear any clothing bar some tattered briefs, covering up his crotch. It gave her plenty of thickly-furred, muscular bear body to admire. One of those strong hands held a modest bouquet of flowers. With a nervous shuffle he handed them to his date.

"Wow..." She says slowly, feeling somewhat relieved this wasn't all some elaborate joke. The bear man just chuckles. "Hehe, I don't get that a lot from humans. It's mostly screaming and running for their lives."

"Running? From a handsome, kind fellow like you?" Simone jokes, beckoning him to enter as she leads the way. Chester ducks down a little to fit through the door, his large frame only barely allowing him to squeeze through. He knew this was going to happen and with a kind, patient smile he followed her into the living room. The werebear carefully stepped on the carpet, trying to make sure his claws wouldn't inadvertently damage the floor.

The living room was candle-lit and she gestured towards the couch. Chester slowly sat himself down, not wanting to break her furniture with his weight. "It's okay, if it can handle two of my fat aunts, you should be fine." She says with a giggle. He lets out a sigh of relief. Something tells the woman this has gone horribly wrong on a previous date for him. "Just relax for a minute, I'll get the food and put these away." She points at the flowers as she wanders into the kitchen. A minute later she returns, holding a large serving tray with two plates.

Chester laughed as he saw the uneven portions on the plate. Simone had cooked a whole chicken, but only put a single leg on her plate, letting the werebear have the rest. She also replaced his cutlery with a chef's knife and a large table fork to accommodate his oversized paws. "Figured you'd appreciate something a little bit more your size. Besides, wouldn't the regular silverware cause problems for you or is that only werewolves?"

The werebear let out a thundering laugh. "Haha, those stories are a bit exaggerated. First it'd have to go into my bloodstream so you'd need to stab me with the silverware, and I don't think this is that kind of date." She laughs in response. "Second, it's more like an allergic reaction. If I get to a hospital I'll be fine. but enough talk for now, this food looks absolutely delicious."

She blushes a little at his compliment and prepares to dig in. How are Chester's table manners?
1212.title: Chester, a werebear

choices: Simone gets wrapped in a big, gentle hug
Chester leans in for a kiss
Chester goes overboard with the hug
12122.content:
He politely takes the knife and fork provided and places them on the salon table in front of him. Simone was a little curious what he was up to, but seeing his hungry gaze made it quite evident what was about to happen. Chester carefully lifted the plate and opened his maw wide. Rows of gleaming, pointy teeth lined around a dark gullet. It was a frightening sight for her, but she knew he'd never think about using them on her. The chicken on the other hand, was not so lucky.

Chester tore in to his food with the fevered zeal of a starving animal. His big maw effortlessly chomped through the cooked bird, undeterred by bones or other things Simone might opt out of. In 10 seconds flat he'd wolfed down everything on his plate, looking up to see the look of mild shock on his date's face.

"Oh... oh my... I'm sorry. It's just that it smelled so nice and... I just got... uhm... carried away." He smiles awkwardly, embarrassed by what he'd just done. Thankfully Simone was willing to defuse the situation with a polite laugh.

"Haha, I'll take it as a compliment to my cooking." She ate some of her own plate. She had nailed the recipe, no wonder Chester went feral on that chicken. She was half tempted to grab her leg of chicken and tear into it herself as a joke. "Yeah..." He just stammered.

"Aw, it's okay." Simone said, putting down her plate. "You're still my gentle soft cuddle-bear." She leans in closer, brushing up against his densely furred side. She had only talked to him through the app before, where he boasted about being like a big, living teddy bear. Now she was finally laid against the werebear's side and she had to conclude that he was grossly underselling just how soft he was. She expected it to be a little coarse and bristly, but it felt like he had taken a bath in conditioner before, his fur was soft and smooth as velvet.
12122.title: He wolfs his meal down like a hungry animal

choices: He apologizes profusely
He panics and runs off
Holy shit, he'd crushed her to death!
121223.content:
Chester smiles as he feels the woman cuddle up to his side. He stretches a little, reaching his arm around her and preparing to give her what she's so clearly looking for. Simone just hums contently, wanting the nervous werebear to feel at ease. She's been on more than a few awkward first dates. Suddenly she feels herself shift as he lifts her on top of him. Her head is resting on top of his broad chest and his body makes for a very comfortable soft-furred pillow. He gently lays his arm around her to stop her from falling off and softly whispers in her ear.

"Do you like it? I hope I'm not too forward, but you seemed to enjoy the fuzz a lot." He stammers nervously. "I did tell you I'm like a big teddy bear, didn't I?" Chester adds with a chuckle.

"Hmmm... If nothing else, you were underselling it." She responds, giggling at his awkwardness. "Now relax. Give me a big fuzzy hug."

He didn't need to be told twice and wraps his arms around the human laid against his chest. He took her into a firm embrace, letting her enjoy the endless landscape of soft-furred werebear. Chester closed his eyes and felt her warmth against his body. He could even softly feel her heartbeat. As he hugs her tighter it increased. She must really like the bear hugs. If so, he would not disappoint her.

Simone feels his arm shift and grab the back of her head. He pressed it face first into the smooth fur of his chest. At the same time he also increases the intensity of his hug. His strength easily overpowered her and struggling was made nearly impossible in this firm embrace. Her arms were pinned to her sides and she couldn't open her mouth to call out to him. She heard Chester murr happily. Was he deliberately trying to hurt her or did he forget his strength again? As the hug got tighter she felt pain radiating through her chest. There seemed to be no end to the werebear's power, the pressure increasing by the second.

Chester happily hummed and hugged his date. He feels her heartbeat rising quicker and quicker, imagining Simone utterly in love with his heavy cuddly embrace. After this he might work up the guts to ask her for a kiss. He was completely oblivious to the damage he was doing, hugging her ever more tightly. When he opened his eyes again he finally realized what had happened.
121223.title: Chester goes overboard with the hug

choices: Simone forgives Chester, asking him to stay
Simone calms Chester, but they agree to continue on a later date
Simone doesn't hear from Chester again
1212232.content:
Simone was so nice and soft he'd give her all the fuzzy hugs she could want. But when Chester finally looked down to see if she was having a good time he realized he was close to breaking her. His feral nature had gotten the better of him again and he'd probably hurt his date. The moment he released his hug she pushed up and took a deep breath of air. The look of pain and fear in her eyes was one he wouldn't soon forget. He gasped in horror and pushed her off.

Chester didn't know what to do. He looked around in a panic, burning up with embarrassment. He could think of only one thing to do and ran for the door. "Sorry! Sorry! Sorry!" was the only thing coming out of his mouth as he attempted to get away from this ruined date as fast as possible. His heavy footsteps echoed through the house. By the time Simone had regained her bearings he was already near the front door.

"Wait!" She cried out, hoping to catch up with the werebear before he left. His hug had done a real number on her, but it had stopped before any permanent damage could be done. Granted, it didn't feel that way when she was being squeezed that hard, but she didn't want him leaving thinking he'd injured her.

"Hold up! I'm okay!" She yelled. The quick beat of his footsteps slowed before he could open the front door. Simone was still a bit shaky on her feet, but she walked after her date. Her step hastened when she heard him hesitantly open the door. She finally caught a glimpse of him when he was about to leave.

"Chester, wait!" She called one last time, but Chester responded with tears in his eyes.

"Simone, I'm so sorry for hurting you... I... I don't think we should see eachother again. If I'd kept going I might have..."
1212232.title: He panics and runs off

choices: Chester tries his best to kiss like a human
Chester licks Simone's face repeatedly
Chester takes Simone's head into his maw
12122321.content:
The werebear winces as he watches his date step closer. Every shake in her movement is because of him, because he couldn't control himself. How could he have been so damn foolish as to think this had any other outcome. Monsters and humans lived separately for exactly this reason. He should go, now that he's merely maimed her and not done worse. He'll think of a way to apologize over the phone later.

The beast's thinking was brought to a sudden stop as he felt something wrap around his torso. Simone pressed herself against him, leaning on his stocky figure to keep balance and hugging him fiercely. It wasn't going to stand up to his efforts earlier, but it was more than enough to snap him out of his cloud of bad thoughts.

"Please Chester... I'm okay. You just caught me by surprise with your intensity. Come on, let's get back to the couch." She looked up into his tearful eyes, hugging a little tighter as a result. "Don't cry, I'm not mad at you." Simone felt his body's tension finally fading. Chester's sorrowful expression slowly turned into a timid smile as he wrapped his arms around her. His hold was a little more shaky, but the werebear was determined not to go overboard again. Simone cracked a smile as she felt him practice his restraint. She didn't anticipate his hug to evolve into sweeping her off her feet and cradling her in his arms.

"Allow me." He said, his voice a low rumble. He saw her stumble before. As much as she was trying to play it off, he was still feeling a little guilty about putting her in such a state. She felt light as air in his arms as he gallantly carried her back to the couch. Chester sat down, keeping Simone in his arms. She snuggled up a little closer to his broad chest, showing no signs of taking a seat next to him. With a smile and a shrug he let her sit in his lap, happy to see her comfortable with him. "Let's continue where we left off." He added, putting his arms around her. He gave his date a gentle squeeze. This time he'd make sure her face wasn't blocked so she could call out if he got too overbearing. But the pleased little hums and moans suggested the exact opposite.

Though he was a little shaken from what had happened so far, the werebear was still unimaginably soft. Simone enjoyed herself greatly. But she had more in mind than just cuddling with her date. She pulled an arm free and reached up to his head. Carefully she guided it down to her own. His breath wasn't too pleasant, but that cute fuzzy face of him was yearning to be kissed.

Chester was a little confused by the gesture. What was she trying to guide him into doing? He looked around the room, panicking a little. Thankfully a clue was there on the salon table. Simone had prepared a movie to watch and the box showed two humans kissing. It looked weird to the werebear. She was eager for a kiss, closing her eyes and waiting for him to react. His kind didn't really do this sort of thing. There were similar gestures of affection though. He couldn't just leave her hanging, he had to do something.
12122321.title: Simone forgives Chester, asking him to stay

choices: Simone asks Chester about monster romance
Chester asks Simone about human romance
Simone has some... unusual questions for Chester
121223212.content:
Chester panicked and resorted to the most common sign of affection he knew. With a wet slap his tongue hit Simone's cheek before dragging all the way across her face. She tried to reel back, but the werebear had gotten a taste in. He would show her love so clear that it was impossible to miss. Lick after lick streaked across her head.

Simone didn't want to open her eyes, lest they become victims in this slobbery assault. The amorous werebear seemed intent on showing her a good time, but this wasn't quite what she signed up for. She loved his handsome looks and his strong embrace, but it hadn't occurred to her that monster habits might differ more strongly than she thought. In hindsight she should probably consider herself lucky their ritual didn't involve anything painful to her. She was still a little sore from his accident earlier in the evening, she dreaded to think what he'd be able to inflict intentionally.

After almost a full minute of ceaseless licking Simone's face was plastered in a layer of drool. Chester relented long enough for her to wipe the worst of it from her eyes. She looked at him with a mix of confusion and frustration. The werebear knew right away that he'd messed up again. His ears drooped and he gave a small sigh. Maybe he shouldn't have tried to get romantic with humans. They're just so different. He couldn't stand to meet her gaze any longer, but as he was wallowing in self-pity the werebear felt something strange.

Simone watching her date's expression turn to sadness and acted in the only way she knew for sure would lift his spirits. She leaned in and though she had to overcome a sense of weirdness and revulsion she stuck out her tongue and gave his nose a cute little lick. Hopefully this would let him know she was okay, though she prayed he'd at least pause and ask before unleashing a second drool-soaked barrage.

"Are... Are you okay?" His voice quivered.

"It's alright you little scaredy-bear. If I was gonna get mad at every little thing, it'd be a rotten date anyway. But maybe we just have to communicate a little better, since I think it's clear by now that we approach love in different ways. I bet we can find some common ground though."

Simone didn't mean for her thoughts to immediately leap to the lewdest suggestion, but in the back of her mind she did wonder what that big tongue might feel like on other parts of her body. Though she was betting that big date of hers was also imagining naughty things, judging by the way he was running his hands along her body. It struck her that he'd probably never dated something without a fur coat. Was he drawn to her smoothness in the same way she loved his fluffiness? She blushed a little at the thought, remaining in his embrace for now.
121223212.title: Chester kisses Simone, werebear style

1212233.content:
Simone's panicked struggles were completely drowned out by the amorous werebear as he hugged her ever tighter. Only once he opened his eyes did he see what he had done. His savage strength had crushed his date. Tears flowed from her eyes as she was barely clinging on to life. Chester's eyes shot wide open. How could this have happened? How did he not notice sooner? What had he done? He shifted nervously, drawing a pained gurgle from Simone. Was there anything left he could do?

"Oh no... I'm so sorry Simone... I never should have done this..." He muttered, terrified and sad. He'd never dated a human before, how was he to know they were this fragile? His expression hardened as his thoughts turned to what he would do next. The woman in his arms was in pain. The damage done was too severe and Chester gulped as he realized there was only one thing left for him to do. He would make Simone's final moments as happy as he could.

Carefully the werebear cradled his date, guiding her lips towards his. They met in a passionate kiss. Chester tried to justify Simone's lack of movement by thinking he'd take charge. But it didn't stop the whole thing from being bittersweet. He'd killed the woman who loved him. Now he would make sure it would be painless.

Simone was barely able to discern what was happening anymore, her consciousness fading fast. She felt her date's kiss. It was strangely nice, but got lost amidst the rollercoaster of emotions she felt. All at once she felt angry at his clumsiness, betrayed by his monstrous nature and saddened that his brute strength had caused him to do this. Topping all these feelings was overwhelming numbness, the intense pain suppressed by her adrenaline. She was no medical professional, but she could tell no hospital would be able to save her. Chester held her close to his chest before giving her the last kind gesture he could think of.

The werebear grunted, flexing his muscles and ending his date's suffering. It took no more than a second to snap her spine with a dull crunch. He let out a sigh of relief, happy that her agony was over. He felt embarrassed, guilty that he couldn't control himself. Now his human date was dead. This wasn't supposed to have happened. He'd pictured them living happily together. But if she was this frail, perhaps it was better that he didn't grow too attached just yet. He sat for minutes, feeling Simone's body go cold whilst his inner turmoil played out. At the end of it he set her beside him on the couch and with a weary sigh he prepared to leave. Hopefully future dates wouldn't end this badly.

He looked over his shoulder to Simone one last time. Right at that moment his belly rumbled. The dinner she cooked was nice, but hardly enough to fill a big werebear like him up. And the way she was sitting there, she did look awfully appetizing. It'd be a shame to let her go to waste. "It's what she would've wanted." He muttered to himself as he approached his love one last time, drool leaking from his maw.

Chester left Simone's house with an awkward smile, patting his somewhat swollen belly. He slipped into the dark, pulling out his phone and loading up Monstr. Better luck next date...
1212233.title: Too much bear hug

More monsters
